moves.1. e4:
my prefered opening move. i have read a comment that this a losing move.
i don't see how one could ascertain such a conclusion, given there is only one move made, aside from esp.
moves.2... Nc6 3. Bc4 h6:
h6 has been played against this opening often, in my own experience.
to defend the f7 pawn and a rook Q fork as well as hindering the knights forward movement
moves.4. d4:
i am looking to open the middle and attack. keeping the king from castling
and gaining lead in development. the reason for this opening is to start the battling early
moves.4... d6 5. Be3: he hasn't taken the pawn instead he defended his e pawn. i continue to develop. Be3 seems ideal spot can cover much ground from here, is not currently blocking me in and adds support to d4
moves.5... Nf6: developing and attacking e4.  i wonder if f5 is better
moves.6... Bg4: this move is another reason why Be3 was a prefered move early on
moves.7. h3 Bxf3 8. gxf3: i take with pawn to open up g file
moves.8... Na5 9. Bb3: i move here cause my king is in good shape in the middle and if he takes i could flank my rook
moves.9... exd4: he now takes the pawn but i wonder why after he takes the N out of play
moves.10... Nxb3 11. axb3 d5 12. Bxf6: i take anticipatinghe takes with Q and Nxd5 threatening the Q and im up a pawn
moves.14... O-O-O: curious? this gains me a pawn
moves.15. Rxa7 Kd7: his caslting only caused him to be shoved back into the middle where i wanted him
moves.16. Rxb7: now im up another pawn and threatening Rc7.  i continued to take peaces instead of developing more support for attack so there would be less to manuever around and it was not at all dangerous to me
moves.17. f4: openin up diagonal for queen.  also begening pawn atack on his Q
moves.17... Ke8 18. Qg4 Ra8 19. O-O:
had to castle now and it is in no way to his advantage to trade queens.
also you see c7 is now open for my N and the position is even better than before.
moves.19... h5: he has forgotten about the c7 pawns vulnerability, toconcerned with my Q
moves.20. Qf5 g6 21. Nxc7+: i wanted my Q where i could manuever better and keep the attack constant before making theN move
moves.21... Kd8: i get a free pawn and its nealy over.
moves.23. Ne6+:
there were simply too many attackers for his queen to defend against.

i think that blacks castling was the major point for whites advantage
